Module main
Package com.vtuberrush.src.ui

Class ToolBar

java.lang.Object
com.vtuberrush.src.ui.Bar
com.vtuberrush.src.ui.ToolBar
public class ToolBar extends Bar
A toolbar is a subclass of a bar used for selecting and placing down tiles in the game's built-in level editor.
A toolbar contains a collection of Tile Buttons which can be selected and placed down when clicking on the playing field.
Version:
0.0.1-alpha.1
Author:
Gio Carlo Ciudadano

  • Constructor Details

    • ToolBar

      public ToolBar​(int x, int y, int width, int height, Editing editing)
      Creates a new bar in defined location, and initializes all tile buttons and tile sprites.
      Parameters:
      x - - The horizontal position of the bar from the left of the window in pixels.
      y - - The vertical position of the bar from the top of the window in pixels.
      width - - The horizontal size of the bar in pixels.
      height - - The vertical size of the bar in pixels.
      editing - - Defines the specific instance of the scene where the tool bar is initialized.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw​(Graphics graphics)
      Renders the tool bar and all buttons.
      Parameters:
      graphics - - Responsible for drawing objects to the screen.

    • getVariant

      public void getVariant()
      Switches the current variant or rotation of a tile category.

    • mouseClicked

      public void mouseClicked​(int x, int y)
      Traverses the list of buttons and checks if a mouse being clicked is within bounds of a button, executing the relevant method associated with the button.
      Parameters:
      x - - The horizontal position of the mouse from the left of the window in pixels.
      y - - The vertical position of the mouse from the top of the window in pixels.

    • mouseMoved

      public void mouseMoved​(int x, int y)
      Traverses the list of buttons and checks if the position of a mouse is within bounds of a button, dynamically updating the color of the tile button when hovered.
      If the mouse is not hovered, the hovered condition is set to false by default.
      Parameters:
      x - - The horizontal position of the mouse from the left of the window in pixels.
      y - - The vertical position of the mouse from the top of the window in pixels.

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed​(int x, int y)
      Traverses the list of buttons and checks if the mouse being pressed is within bounds of a button, dynamically updating the border color of the tile button when pressed.
      Parameters:
      x - - The horizontal position of the mouse from the left of the window in pixels.
      y - - The vertical position of the mouse from the top of the window in pixels.

    • mouseReleased

      public void mouseReleased​(int x, int y)
      Dynamically resets all buttons after a button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      x - - The horizontal position of the mouse from the left of the window in pixels.
      y - - The vertical position of the mouse from the top of the window in pixels.

    • getImageStart

      public BufferedImage getImageStart()
      Returns the tile sprite of the start flag.
      Returns:
      imageStart

    • getImageEnd

      public BufferedImage getImageEnd()
      Returns the tile sprite of the end flag.
      Returns:
      imageEnd
